entry.title: I’m getting a new phone. How can I transfer my data
entry.content:
Option 1:

If you have the same gmail account in both phones: Go to backup, tap on backup on the old phone, wait a few seconds and then on the new phone: go to back up and then hit the Restore button.

Option 2:

You have multiple backups in your sd card: Copy the folder named: 90Droid from the old phone to the new one. Then go to the Back up screen and tap Restore from SD.

entry.title: 90Droid v7.9 Released
entry.content:
This is a HUGE release for 90Droid

YouTube videos of your workouts:

Now you can link your exercises to videos in YouTube!

If you see the YouTube icon above, simply tap on it and you will watch it right there:

Credit to Laura London

YouTube video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HK6mKUEY09o

Her Page: http://www.lauralondonfitness.com

New cleaner more modern interface:

If you have android 3.0 or Higher, you'll see the new cleaner interface

Import from 90Droid Free button:

If you have the free version and want to upgrade, simply have them both installed and go to the premium version > Backup/Restore and hit the "Import from 90Droidfree". That's it, when you see the success message you are ready to use the premium version.

New Exercise Type: Timer

This is a count timer, when you star it you'll hear a beep

Shows in yellow and beeps a warning sound when you get to 10 seconds

You'll get a different beep when you are done

 

As an Example we have shared the Laura London Standing up Abs one week program that uses this timers

Quick sorting of Days:

It is now very easy to change the order of your days, simply drag and drop in the new interface:

Go to the Programs Editor and select "Quick Sort" from the menu

Then just drag an drop the list from the handle. Once you are done hit Save.

entry.title: 90Droid v7.2 Released
entry.content:
The most requested feature by power users:  Sorting of the days in a program definition. Here is how:

Go to Programs

Tap on the menu icon right the  (editable) Program. If not editable, hit menu and clone, that will give you a new program that you can modify

Once on the Edit screen tap the menu button at the bottom left of the screen and select More

Then select Quick-sort days:

Once there sort the days by pulling the days up or down by the handles on the left side:

Once you are happy with the results, hit save:

And the changes are displayed as you are taken back to the edit screen

Please keep in mind that this is still under construction but it is working very well so far. Please let us know of any comments you might have .

Happy new year's everybody

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid on Kindle Fire
entry.content:
We have found the problem that makes the Kindle Fire force close with 90Droid. To prevent it please do the following: Main Screen > Preferences > (Uncheck) Disable auto key lock. Please let us know if you have any other questions/comments.

Regards,
Team 90Droid

entry.title: How do I track X2 with 90Droid?
entry.content:
From the main screen go to Programs > Menu > Download More.

There you'll find many exercise programs shared by the community, such as P90X2, Hybrids, and many others.

Please note that, P90X2 is a trademark of Beachbody, you'll need the DVDs for instruction on how to do the exercises. And we are not related to Beachbody in any way.

Enjoy
Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v4.6 Released
entry.content:
This version offers a way to enter previous workouts, a frequently requested feature.

To do that simply tap on menu > Show Workout Date, this will set the date for the workout, this date will be persistent so you can enter as many as you need for the same day.

If the workout date is not shown, today's date will be used as usual.

Enjoy,

Team 90Droid

* Added the ability to create your own dumbbell sets/band sets* Now you can switch between bands and dumbbells * Now you can create your own custom exercises.

Team 90Droid

entry.title: What is the Account/Internet Permission used for?
entry.content:
The app requires permissions to your google account so you don't have to manually sign in whenever you want to do a back up to/restore from the cloud. Please note that all we do is ask google for a token to see if your account is valid so we can store your data securely and nobody else has access to it. We however, don't get access to your password or personal information.

The internet permission is also used to back up/restore from the cloud, as well as for validating the license and gathering anonymous information on the performance of the app. Rest assured that we don't share any data with third parties.

Team 90Droid.

entry.title: How do I start over?
entry.content:
We've been getting this question since version 1. That's why we created the Cycles module, here is how it works:

A cycle is nothing but a range of dates for a specific program. for example: P90X Classic from January 1st to March 2nd.

  • It doesn't have to cover the whole program
  • You can set the start and end dates that you want.
  • When you set a cycle as active, your records will be filtered to display only the ones within that date range.

Having said that, if you want to "start over", all you need to do is create a new cycle, set the starting date as today and make it active, that will only show what you do from now on. So,  if you want to go back and see what you did before, you can change the dates in the cycle or you can mark it as inactive in the edit screen.

entry.title: I do more than 40 reps, how do I track them?
entry.content:
Go to the main screen
Hit the menu key
Select preferences
Tap on max reps and type your new maximum

entry.title: How do I change the program (Classic, Doubles, Lean)
entry.content:
In order to change the program please do the following:

Go to the main screen (The one with the list of days)
Then press the menu key on your phone
From the menu you can select Preferences
There you can select the program from the list.

Starting v 4.0 we added 'program manager' to the main menu, it will show you the list of programs. Long-tap on the one you want and set as active. Hit back, you'll see the change in the days

So if you are ready for the next level, all you need to do is select the The plus workouts, that is three new Programs: Plus Classic, Plus Lean and Plus Doubles. and new Workout Groups: Upper, Total Body, Abs Core, Interval. And since it's part of the app, you get charts, backup and all the features that make 90Droid unique.

To celebrate this launch we have reduced the price of the app for a limited time, so go ahead and take advantage of this opportunity.

Enjoy
Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid is not saving my workouts
entry.content:
Symptom: When you hit save on a workout then hit prev to see the results, you don't see the item in the history.

Your workout is being saved it's just not showing in the "previous" list

Solution: go to Cycles and make sure that the active cycle includes today's date. The easiest way to do this is to leave the end-date empty, that will include everything from the start date on.

We created cycles to help you filter previous workouts without having to delete them. If you set a cycle as active but the end-date does not include today's date, the history list will not display them. All you will see is a warning.

Addendum: We have created a new post that can give you some other clues: Filtering Records

Team 90Droid.

entry.title: 90Droid says it’s not installed after update
entry.content:
Some 90Droid users have reported that the only way to access the app is to go to the Android Market and launch it from there.

If this happens to you please do the following:

  1. Open the app (by going to the market),
  2. Backup your workouts (Make sure you get a success message) If backup doesn't work for any reason stop here and send us an email
  3. Uninstall the app
  4. Go to the market and download it again
  5. Go to Restore.

If you follow this instructions you will get the app to work and you won't lose any data. The cause for this problem is a change in the licensing service for Android. Unfortunately we don't have control over this within the App. We are sorry for this inconvenience.

Please let us know if you have any questions or problems with this approach.

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid not showing in the Android Market/Stopped working after Froyo update
entry.content:
Hello everybody,

We have received many emails telling us that 90Droid disappeared from the Android Market or cannot be accessed after a Froyo update.
Unfortunately, we don't really have control over the delivery of the app (downloading and installing it). That is controlled by the android market. Please contact them using their support page: Android Market Support Page
They are usually pretty good at resolving any issues.

Doing a quick google search, I found the following thread that discusses possible solutions http://www.google.com/support/forum/p/Android%20Market/thread?tid=0b929effaf6c8573&hl=en

I hope this helps, let us know of any other concerns you might have.

entry.title: 90Droid v2.6.5 Released
entry.content:
On this version:

* Minor fixes to the backup functionality (User Interface)

* Included waist measurement column when on landscape mode. (Thank you JD)

entry.title: 90Droid v2.6.2 Released
entry.content:
On this release we address a common concern amongst users:  Backup/Restore. Here is how it works:

In the main screen press the "menu" key and select "Backup/Restore".

Back up

Click on the "Backup" button and the process starts:

You need to select a google account from the list (to be used to log you in)

Both your Workouts and Measurements are uploaded to a secure google server. Note: this will overwrite the previous backup.

Restore

Click on the "Restore" button and the process starts:

You need to select a google account from the list (to be used to log you in)

You will be presented with a list of devices that have had back ups using the same google account. (Useful to back up in one device and restore in another) Select one of them.

Both your Workouts and Measurements are downloaded from the cloud. Note: this will overwrite your local data.

entry.title: 90Droid v2.5 Released

entry.title: 90Droid v1.7 Released

Also in this release, the visual separation by week in the main screen makes it easier to navigate.

Enjoy,

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v1.6 Released
entry.content:
This release includes the long-requested custom notes. Now you can type your comments on every exercise. Here is how it works:

When you click on the notes button you get this screen where you can type any comment you want

You can also  select any of the quick notes on the list. This will replace whatever was in the text field

Once the notes are saved, they will be displayed in a short format in the previous list. Ellipsis denote text too long to display in that space. Also note that the Date is now displayed in a new column

To read the full-length text:

Long-press over the element in the previous list and select"View Notes"

That will display the notes for that workout instance

entry.title: 90Droid v1.5 Released
entry.content:
One of the most requested features, the ability to select between Lean and Classic.

Note: The programs are independent from each other. So your history in Lean is independent of the one in Classic

entry.title: 90Droid v1.4 Released
entry.content:
One of the most anticipated releases is finally out. It features  multiple measurements tracking.

If you are doing p90x you want to keep track of your weight and body fat percentage. You also want to see your results by comparing your measurements with certain frequency and add notes to help you with your progress.

To reach the measurements list screen press menu and select measurements.

Enjoy

Team 90Droid

entry.title: 90Droid v1.3 Released

entry.title: 90Droid v1.1 Released

entry.title: 90Droid v1.0 Released
entry.content:
We have released the first version of 90Droid, a fitness tracker for P90X.

As P90X grads and after trying several apps, we realized that there was a need for a fitness trackers created specifically for p90X. These are the design guidelines:

  • You must be able to log a workout with minimum effort. Let's face it, in the middle of your workout you don't want to waste time typing.
  • You should be able to be up and running the minute you download the app.  The app should come pre-configured with the most common options.
  • You should love it. It should make you want to workout and complete the program.

Enjoy

Team 90Droid
